roboRallyPackage

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • roboRallyPackage.Terminatable
      • roboRallyPackage.Board

  • public class Board
extends Terminatable
    A class representing a game board.
    Version:
    24 may 2012
    Author:
    Jonas Schouterden (r0260385) & Nele Rober (r0262954) Bachelor Ingenieurswetenschappen, KULeuven

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board(long width,
     long height)
        Constructs a Board with the given width and height. If these given width and height are not valid values, the width and the height will both be set to 10.
        Parameters:
        width - The width for this new Board.
        height - The height for this new Board.

        public void terminate()

      • getFirstElementStartingAt

        public Element getFirstElementStartingAt(Position position,
                                Orientation orientation)
                                  throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Returns an element placed on this board on the first position one encounters while moving forward in a straight line starting from the given position with the given orientation. When multiple elements are placed on the first encountered position, only one of these elements is returned. The choice of which element to be returned happens semi-randomly. When no elements are found when 'you have reached the end of this Board', this method will return 'null'.
        Parameters:
        position - The position to start from
        orientation - The direction where the other position may lie, respectively to the current position (up, down,...).
        Returns:
        ... | for each i in 1..Long.MAX_VALUE: | if(! (this.getElements(position.getNeighbourAt(orientation, i)) == null)) | then for one element in this.getElements(position.getNeighbourAt(orientation, i)) | result == element
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - ... | position == null || orientation == null

      • removeElement

        public void removeElement(Element element)
                   throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                          java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Removes a given element from this Board if it is placed on this board. The board of this element will be set null, the position of this element is not changed.
        Parameters:
        element - The element that will be removed from this board.
        Throws:
        NullpointerException - ... | element == null
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - ... | element.getBoard() != this
        java.lang.NullPointerException

        public void putElement(Position position,
              Element newElement)
                throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                       java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                       IllegalPositionException,
                       IllegalBoardException,
                       IllegalElementCombinationException
        Places a given element on this board on a given position if this element can be placed there.
        Parameters:
        position - The position where this element has to be placed.
        newElement - The element that will be placed on this board.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - ... | newElement == null
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - ... | newElement.isTerminated()
        IllegalPositionException - ... | ! this.canElementBePutAtPosition(position, newElement)
        IllegalBoardException - ... | ! this.canElementBePutAtPosition(position, newElement)
        IllegalElementCombinationException - ... | ! this.canElementBePutAtPosition(position, newElement)

      • moveElement

        public void moveElement(Position position,
               Element element)
                 throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                        java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                        IllegalPositionException,
                        IllegalBoardException,
                        IllegalElementCombinationException
        Moves a given element from one place on this board to another place on this board if possible. When the element is already standing on that position, nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        position - The position where this element has to be placed.
        element - The element that has to be moved
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - ... | element == null
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - ... | element.isTerminated()
        IllegalPositionException - ... | ! this.canElementBePutAtPosition(position, element)
        IllegalBoardException - ... | !this.getElements(Element.class).contains(element) || ! this.canElementBePutAtPosition(position, element)
        IllegalElementCombinationException - ... | ! this.canElementBePutAtPosition(position, element)

      • canElementBePutAtPosition

        public boolean canElementBePutAtPosition(Position position,
                                Element element,
                                java.util.Map<Position,java.util.Set<Element>> elements)
                                  throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                         IllegalPositionException,
                                         IllegalBoardException,
                                         IllegalElementCombinationException
        Returns whether the given element can be placed on this board at the given position with the given set of elements.
        Parameters:
        position - The position where the new element may have to be placed.
        element - The element that may have to be placed on this board.
        elements - The set of elements that is already placed on this board
        Returns:
        ... | result == isValidPositionOnBoard(position)
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - ... | element == null || elements == null
        IllegalPositionException - ... | ! isValidPositionOnBoard(position)
        IllegalBoardException - ... | element.getBoard() != null && element.getBoard() != this
        IllegalElementCombinationException - ... | for some oldElement in this.getElements(position): | ! oldElement.canSharePositionWith(element)

      • merge

        public void merge(Board other)
           throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Merges a given board with this board. This means that all the elements of the given board are moved to this board if possible, otherwise they are terminated. The other board is also terminated at the end.
        Parameters:
        other - The other board that has to be merged with this board.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateExceptions - ... | this.isTerminated() || other.isTerminated()
        java.lang.IllegalStateException

      • createListVertices

        public java.util.List<OrientatedPosition> createListVertices(Robot robot)
                                                      throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Returns a list of orientatedPositions that are approximately reachable by this robot. This means that he may have enough energy to reach it. All the orientatedPostions that are not in the list, are either not reachable (the robot certainly has not enough energy to reach it) or the robot cannot be placed there (e.g. there is a wall there)
        Parameters:
        robot - The robot for which to calculate the list of vertices.
        Returns:
        ... | for each orientatedPosition in OrientatedPosition: | result.contains(orientatedPosition) | || orientatedPosition.getPosition().getManhattanDistance(robot.getPosition()) >= robot.getEnergy(EnergyUnit.WATTSECOND)/robot.getTotalCostToMove() | || this.canElementBePutAtPosition(orientatedPosition.getPosition(),robot)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - | robot.getBoard() != this || robot.isTerminated()

      • createDiGraphForRobot

        public EdgeWeightedDigraph createDiGraphForRobot(Robot robot)
                                          throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Creates an EdgeWeightedDigraph for the given robot. This means that all the vertices from this.createListVertices(robot) and all the valid connections (edges) between them are included.
        Parameters:
        robot - The robot to calculate the edgeWeightedDigraph for.
        Returns:
        ... | result.V() == this.createListVertices(robot).size()
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - | robot.getBoard() != this || robot.isTerminated()

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this board.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        ... | result == "Board: (width, height) = (" + this.getWidth() + "," + this.getHeight() + ")"
